main event: An unidentified object was observed during a recovery operation near Ascension Island in 1960.
interesting points: The object was initially thought to be a plane, but did not appear on radar.
The object was described as a bright surface flare that persisted for approximately 10 seconds.
Crew members were unable to identify the light or its source.

A second sighting involved an object that appeared to be a double cone-shaped object approximately 50-60 feet in length and 20-25 feet in height, which rapidly accelerated vertically at a rate in excess of 8-10,000 feet per minute.
The report indicates that neither aircraft involved had dropped any object during the test.
sighted object: bright surface flare, double cone-shaped object
witnesses: Military and civilian personnel involved in the recovery operation
